sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Armenia is a landlocked country in the South Caucasus region, known for its ancient history, mountainous landscapes, and strong cultural identity.

sections.title: Capital City
sections.content: Yerevan is the capital and largest city of Armenia, serving as its political, cultural, and economic hub.

sections.title: Currency
sections.content: The official currency is the Armenian dram (AMD).

sections.title: Language
sections.content: The official language is Armenian, written in its unique alphabet created in the 5th century.

sections.title: Traditional Food
sections.content: Popular dishes include khorovats (barbecue), dolma (stuffed grape leaves), lavash (flatbread), and khash, a traditional soup.

sections.title: Geography
sections.content: Armenia is a mountainous country with the Lesser Caucasus range, fertile valleys, and Lake Sevan. Mount Ararat, though located in Turkey, is a national symbol visible from Yerevan.

sections.title: History
sections.content: Armenia is one of the worldâ€™s oldest nations, with roots in the Kingdom of Urartu and the Kingdom of Armenia. It was the first country to adopt Christianity as a state religion in 301 AD.

sections.title: Culture
sections.content: Armenian culture emphasizes music, dance, literature, and religious traditions. The Armenian Apostolic Church plays a central role in national identity.

sections.title: Tourism
sections.content: Tourism highlights include ancient monasteries like Geghard and Tatev, the Temple of Garni, Lake Sevan, and the vibrant capital city of Yerevan.

sections.title: Fun Fact
sections.content: Chess is a national passion in Armenia, and the country has produced several world champion grandmasters.
